episode_summary: This episode features discussions on historical divorce laws, the life of percussionist Emil Richards, the history of Dracula theater productions, and a humorous mix-up involving the Canadian Prime Minister and a cat named Thatcher.

facts.fact: In ancient Hebrew times, men could get a divorce if their wife had been alone in a room with another man.
The same fingers are responsible for the clicks in the Adams Family theme, the bongos in the Mission Impossible theme, and the xylophone in the Simpsons theme.
In 2024, the first ever theater production of Dracula will celebrate its hundredth anniversary.

In 2008, the Canadian Prime Minister called 10 Downing Street to offer condolences for the death of Margaret Thatcher, who was not dead; it was a misunderstanding due to the death of the Canadian Transport Minister's cat, also named Thatcher.
